title: Panic in compilation of project using openssl (vendored)

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Description I'm getting this error when cross compiling a project that has `openssl` with the `vendored` feature from `aarch64-apple-darwin` to `x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu`. In the past this was not a problem, I could do this just fine for the last 8 months. And after removing the `openssl` dependency I can do it perfectly. If you're wondering how I setup the linkers, pretty much just followed [this guide](https://github.com/messense/homebrew-macos-cross-toolchains) Tried to switch to rustc version 1.63. Same issue, nightly rust as well. Openssl dep: [rust-openssl](https://github.com/sfackler/rust-openssl) ### Code ```Rust NONE ``` (No code, tested on a literal empty project.) ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.67.1 (d5a82bbd2 2023-02-07) binary: rustc commit-hash: d5a82bbd26e1ad8b7401f6a718a9c57c96905483 commit-date: 2023-02-07 host: aarch64-apple-darwin release: 1.67.1 LLVM version: 15.0.6 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', compiler/rustc_codegen_llvm/src/back/archive.rs:367:33 ```
Backtrace

``` Compiling openssl-sys v0.9.80 Compiling openssl v0.10.45 thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', compiler/rustc_codegen_llvm/src/back/archive.rs:367:33 stack backtrace: 0: _rust_begin_unwind 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt 2: core::panicking::panic 3: ::build 4: rustc_codegen_ssa::back::link::link_binary 5: ::link 6: ::link 7: rustc_span::with_source_map::, rustc_interface::interface::run_compiler, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}::{closure#0}> 8: >::set::, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorGuaranteed>> note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.67.1 (d5a82bbd2 2023-02-07) running on aarch64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: --crate-type lib -C opt-level=3 -C embed-bitcode=no -C linker=x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu-gcc note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack error: could not compile `openssl-sys` ```
